title: Please Don't Say Just "Hello" In Chat
subtitle: Hello!
description: Starting a chat with "Hello" and waiting for a response is inefficient. Here's why:

problem.title: The Problem
problem.description: Imagine calling someone on the phone, saying "Hello!" and then putting them on hold. That's essentially what you're doing when you send a message that just says "Hello."

bad.title: Bad:
messages: I have a question about my code
OK, let me take a look‚Ä¶

good.title: Good:
messages: Hi - I'm having trouble with the login form. When I submit it, nothing happens. Can you take a look?
Sure, I'll check it out. Can you send me the error from the console?

solution.title: The Solution
solution.description: Instead of just saying "Hello", include your question or request in the first message. This way:
benefits: The other person can start thinking about your question immediately
They can respond when they have time, even if you're not online

examples.title: More Examples
good: Hi - I need help with the deployment script. It's failing on step 3.
Hello - Can you review my PR when you have a chance? It's about the user authentication.
Hey - Quick question: what's the API endpoint for user profiles?
Hi there - The database migration is taking longer than expected. Should I cancel it?

footer.text: Remember: In asynchronous communication, context is everything. Include your question or request in your first message.

questions.question: What is the main problem with sending just 'Hello' in a chat message?
options: It forces the other person to wait and respond before you share your actual question
It's not allowed in most chat applications

questions.question: What should you include in your first message instead of just saying 'Hello'?
options: Your full name and contact information

questions.question: Which of these is an example of a good first message?
options: Hello - I'm having trouble with the login form. When I submit it, nothing happens. Can you take a look?

questions.question: Why is including your question in the first message beneficial?
options: The other person can start thinking about your question immediately, respond when they have time, and you get your answer faster
It's required by chat platform rules
